text: this is Kenya and I'm getting my degree
all over the world
[Music]
twenty-one-year-old Kenya originally
comes from the northern part of Spain
and she's been a traveler all her life
parents and then when I was seven my dad
passed away and so my mom and I we kept
traveling quite a bit we went to Paris
the States it did help us get over some
stuff for my first communion set up
asking for a phone I asked for money so
I could travel to Egypt where I wanted
to go
and her travel bug led her to the idea
of studying abroad for high school when
I was 16 I got this scholarship to go
studying Canada for a year fully funded
and they even gave me monies to spend
there at this point she was used to
studying in other countries and so for
college she applied to this brand-new
schooling concept called Minerva which
had a 1.9 percent admission rate she got
in so the first year we stay in San
Francisco for the whole year and we all
learned the same thing so instead of
just teaching your theory they teach us
how to think and then after the second
year you start choosing your majors and
I'm majoring in history and molecular
biology the entire school calendar is
based on spending four months in six
countries as a group South Korea India
Germany Argentina UK and Taiwan I went
to University of wisconsin-madison I
studied that for four years I did do one
semester abroad but almost everything
was in a classroom with like 500 people
and that's the traditional way of
learning what are the benefits of
learning in Minerva
we don't have exams will take debate
style classes and then do a lot of
assignments which basically forces you
to think for yourself the schooling
system is done entirely on their own
online platform think of Skype on
asteroids so we have a lot of like
features and a lot of things you can do
so you can actually interact with your
peers and your teachers more than you
would in a normal classroom and the
teacher is not a lot to talk for more
than four minutes so you have to debate
and they will calling you and you have
to demonstrate that you understand them
it I just want to say so she's really
confident when she talks I really met a
21 year old that's this mature that's
this confident you can see it's already
paying off the school that he's getting
what Kenya is telling me is
revolutionary and I've seen our society
slowly evolved this way ever since I
studied abroad in Prague seven years ago
not only our College is offering more
study abroad programs
like semester at sea but there are other
options like remote year and global
degree which escape the traditional
classroom and teach you life skills in
the real world
the thing about Minerva doesn't only
teach you to like perform a job it
actually teaches you how to be a global
citizen to be able to live anywhere and
face any challenge anywhere the future
is bright for education and it's also
bright for this young girl who is a
pioneer of getting her degree around the
world I'm already getting itching to
start traveling again and I can't wait
to finish my studies in London and
Taipei for my first communion instead of
asking for a phone I actually asked for
